lom:description.lom:string: Los Alamos National Laboratory's library staff have assembled a fine collection of reference material in the earth sciences. Though many of the databases and journals have restricted or limited use, many of the other links are fine reference tools for those researching earth science topics.

This site contains many earth science related resources available online. They include: * Electronic journals (mostly available at LANL only but citations for some are available) * Databases and Indexes * Book Series * Illustrated Glossary of Geoogic Terms (an excellent glossary with continuing updates for images) * AGI Directory * Association for Women Geoscientists * Digital Elevation Data Catalogue * Global Change Master Directory * American Water Works Association White Papers * National Archive of Geological Photographs (British Geological Survey) * Virtual Geomorphology (an electronic textbook) with many more available sorted by subject: * Cartography * Earthquakes * Geophysics * Global Change * Hydrology * Mineralogy * Modelling * Natural Hazards * Oil and Gas * Ozone * Remote Sensing * Solid Waste * Volcanology * Weather, Meteorology & Climate

lom:keyword.lom:string: Earth sciences, reference tools, cartography, earthquakes, geophysics, global change, hydrology, mineralogy, modelling, natural hazards, oil, gas, ozone, remote sensing, solid waste, volcanology, climate, weather

lom:title.lom:string: Los Alamos National Laboratory: Earth Sciences Library Resources
